meanings.definition: To hesitate or be unwilling to accept an idea or undertaking.
meanings.sent1: She always balks at trying new foods.
meanings.sent2: He balks at the idea of public speaking.
meanings.sent3: The cat balks at wearing a tiny hat.
meanings.sent4: His fear of failure balks him from taking risks.
meanings.sent5: The child balks at bedtime like a stubborn mule.

meanings.definition: A beam used in building construction.
meanings.sent1: The workers carried heavy balks to the construction site.
meanings.sent2: The architect designed the house with sturdy balks.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy chewed on the wooden balk.
meanings.sent4: The old barn stood strong with its weathered balks.
meanings.sent5: The carpenter measured the balk for the new roof.

meanings.sent1: The heavy traffic was a major balk to their plans.
meanings.sent2: Financial difficulties proved to be a significant balk in their project.
meanings.sent3: The sudden rainstorm was an unexpected balk to their picnic.
meanings.sent4: Overcoming the language barrier was a challenging balk for the team.
meanings.sent5: The broken elevator was a frustrating balk on their way to the top floor.
